abstracts.cdata!:
This is the environmental management
            plan for the School Access and Improvement Project in
            Djibouti, and focuses primarily on the situation of the
            sanitary facilities at all schools, which is not only an
            environmental concern, but a health risk as well. During
            rehabilitation, and expansion of schools, it is expected
            that unsuitable materials will pose environmental, and
            health risks. Mitigation measures include: 1) precautionary
            clauses in technical specifications, prescribing the quality
            of materials to be used for construction works, restraining
            insulation materials containing asbestos, and, the use of
            lead-based paint; 2) construction and rehabilitation of
            sanitary facilities, enforcing the above mentioned standards
            for construction materials; 3) preparation of an
            environmental training program for school principals, and,
            an awareness campaign aimed at teachers, students, and
            parents to minimize health risks, and enhance hygiene
            measures in the school environment; 4) the design, and
            introduction of a school upkeep, and maintenance system to
            prevent school degradation; and, 5) an epidemiological study
            on children's health, including information on
            mortality causes among school students, in addition to
            improvements in the medical system to observe
            children's health status, thus facilitating
            decision-making on health issues.
